Alfredo Ascanio

ECOLOGIST & DATA SCIENTIST

Caracas, Venezuela

Biologist graduated from Simón Bolívar University, Venezuela. With experience in experimental ecology, marine ecology, coral reef ecology, estuary ecology, data analysis, and R programming.

Profile - About Me

Alfredo Ascanio
  • Alfredo Ascanio
  • September 24, 1994
  • Caracas, Venezuela
  • ascanio.alfredoa@gmail.com
  • +58 416-4296314
  • alspeed09.github.io

I really enjoy studying and learning about the world that surround us. Specially, I think that marine and other aquatic ecosystems are amazing and need to be studied and protected from human impacts and climate change.

The more time we dedicate to comprehend these ecosystems, its interactions with the surrounding environment, organisms, and us, the faster we will be able to offer solutions that will help the world to have a sustainable and healtier development.

My Services
R programming &
Data Analysis

Statistical analysis using R. Creation of functions or subrutines to analyse data. Use of graphical libraries like "ggplot2" package.

Experimental design

Knowledge of experimental design and descriptive, inferential and predictive statistics.

Spatial analysis

Knowledge of GIS, using R, ArcGIS and the web platform ArcGIS online.

Text mining and analysis

Knowledge about data mining techniques and text analysis, primarily from social networks like Twitter.

Fish stomachal content analysis

Taxonomic identification of fishes, crustaceans, moluscs, and other animal or vegetal groups that can be found within a fish stomachs. Diet analysis and food web analysis.

Identification of Coral Reef Benthic Substrate

Identification of corals and associated benthic organisms, both in the Caribbean sea and Pacific Ocean.

Services descriptions

R Programming & Data Analysis

Since 2015 I've been working with R, making several courses and helping in data management in the Experimental Ecology Laboratory (Simón Bolívar University). Thanks to that, I've learn how to deal with a relatively large amount of data, how to build R functions and how to implement graphics and statistical analysis as needed.

Experimental Design

I have studied and applied concepts of statistical analysis and experimental design. The critical reading of a project is an important part of science, as it is to be capable of making the right recomendations about an experiment's design or the posterior statistical analysis.

Spatial Analysis

For the past two years I've learned how to use and build a GIS using ArcGIS. Also, I've learned how to manage spatial files, like .shp, in R to make changes and quick filters. For the past year I've been working on the development of a web map server using ArcGIS online platform for the project "Conservation of Biodiversity in the Orinoco's Oil Belt", as part of LSIGMA (Geographical Information System and Environmental Modeling Laboratory - Simón Bolívar University)

Text Mining and Analysis

During my communitary service (a 120 hours requisite to obtain Bachelor's Degree in Venezuela), I worked for Provita , an NGO dedicated to biodiversity conservation in Venezuela. At this time I learned how to use several R tools for web scrapping, data mining and text mining. Specially I developed some R scripts adjusted to download an organize Twitter data by searched topic, subtopic, date, and geographical coordinates, as well as other parameters requested by Twitter's API. This can be replicated to other social networks like Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, etc.

Fish Stomachal Content Analysis

For my grade project (undergraduate thesis - requisite for Bachelor's degree), I researched if there was spacial variability associated with the diets of demersal fishes and trophic webs in the marine-estuarine region of the Orinoco's River Delta. In this project I learned how to make stomachal content analysis, how to construct food webs in R, how to make extinsion simulations on those food webs, and many other things.

Identification of Coral Reef Benthic Substrate

For the past 8 months, we at the Experimental Ecology Laboratory have been working with reef benthic surface analysis, identifying benthic organisms like cnidarians, sponges, echinoderms, algaes, etc. These projects are being financed by the Waitt Institue. The majority of the images correspond to different caribbean reefs, from Venezuela, Barbuda, Monserrat, etc. We have also learned how to identify corals of the pacific Ocean, mainly from the Kingdom of Tonga.

My Resume
Download My Resume
Experience
  • Research assistant 2014 - current
    Experimental Ecology Lab - Simón Bolívar University

    The work consists primarily on marine benthic photo-quadrats analysis, data management, data analysis, statistical analysis. Also, I'am participating in several research projects such as: food web analysis in a Venezuelan estuary, coral disease research network, and insights about caribbean reef ecosystems from CARICOMP project.

  • Webmap server developer 2017 - current
    Geographical Information System and Environmental Modeling Lab - Simón Bolívar University

    Developing a webmap server using ArcGIS-Online platform for the project "Biodiversity Conservation on the Orinoco Oil Belt" (Conservación de la Biodiversidad en la Faja Petrolífera del Orinoco) - ConservacionFPO.

  • Undergraduate academic assistant 2013 - 2018
    Simón Bolívar University (USB)

    Assisting several laboratory courses in Biology of Invertebrates, Biology of Vertebrates, Ecology and Statistics. The work consisted in helping the professors and students during different practical laboratory activities, such as field trips, sample collection, statistical analysis and report writing.


Education
  • Bachelor in Biological Sciences 2011 - 2018
    Simón Bolívar University

    Bachelor's degree in Biological Sciences. I focused the two final years of my career in studying and applying the concepts of ecology, experimental ecology, marine ecology, statistical analysis, and R programming.


Courses & Certificates
  • Estuarine fishes identification 2015
    1° Venezuelan Ictiology Conference - Oceanographic Institute of Venezuela
  • Data Scientists Toolbox 2016
    Coursera's Data Science Specialization - John Hopkins University
  • R programming 2016
    Coursera's Data Science Specialization - John Hopkins University

    Coursera's Data Science Specialization - John Hopkins University

Awards
  • Biological Sciences Division's Best Student 2016
    Simón Bolívar University

FlexyVcard - Responsive Vcard Template

FlexyVcard is an impressive and professional online vcard, a beautiful portfolio with sliding effect, resume and contact information with Google map.

It’s simple! Just download and install in a few minutes, you can show your online card to your friend, customer or employer in an interview by phone or tablet. Because FlexyVcard is a responsive template, you can view your website on pc as well as handheld devices. You can also link to your social profiles, display your portfolio in many media format such as image, youtube video, flash...
